name: ZK Email: Email Wallet and Identity Attestations
description:
We announce an email-based account abstraction wallet, allowing users to
 send tokens simply by sending emails, without any actions from 
recipients. By trusting only the original email server (i.e. gmail) and 
not a centralized attester, users can ensure the assets in their wallet 
are secure and available. We describe a simple extension framework that 
lets any developer add arbitrary smart contract calls via emails. In 
addition to the wallet, we describe a more generic proof of email sdk 
that lets anyone verify identities directly from web2 without 
centralized attesters, via proofs of user's emails.

speakers.name: Aayush Gupta
speakers.bio: I am working on proof of email and the email wallet application right now (more info at https://prove.email)! We are using zk proofs of emails to do things like verify social credentials and send money via emails (https://sendeth.org). I am also helping to support work on plume (https://plume.run), an anonymous unique nullifier for ethereum addresses.

speakers.name: Sora Suegami
speakers.bio:
I have been researching how to improve the ability of smart contracts 
with high-functional cryptography, e.g., ZKP, witness encryption, and 
cryptographic obfuscation. I am currently working on proof of email and 
Email Wallet, a contract wallet using emails. They allow smart contracts
 to securely import more kinds of off-chain data that users usually send
 and receive. I also research privacy-preserving smart contracts, 
especially smart contract obfuscation (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.bcra.2022.100118).
